captions.text:
The zookeeper tests her urine
with a pregnancy test kit.
Judy is pregnant.
I think she's pregnant.
Chimpanzees hardly breed in captivity.

Only one baby was born
in the last 10 years.

Why are you showing me
your rear end?
Good girl.
Good girl, Judy.

Thanks to the privacy provided by
the one-way window, they've mated.

The zoo staff is worried because
they remember how Gabsoon had trouble

<i>Gabsoon, female, age: 13</i>
caring for her baby last summer.

So Gabsoon never learned
how to care for babies.
So when she had her baby,

which was very healthy,
she didn't go near it.

Gabsoon didn't know
how to be a mother.
But her baby kept crying...
<i>Gabsoon's baby (7 months old)

The baby chimpanzee is cared
for by humans.
She's separated from her mother.

Drink slowly. Slowly.
Too fast...
That's too fast.

The zookeeper provides
good care to the baby chimp,

but the baby needs to bond
with its mother and be with its kind
or else there could be problems later.
Do you feel better?
Once a baby is cared for by humans,

it has a hard time adjusting to life
with other chimpanzees.

<i>Boram, age: 5</i>
That was the case with Boram.
Boram is Osoon's daughter.

Osoon was very old when she had Boram
and couldn't care for it.
they don't recognize each other.
Although Boram is nearly fully grown,

she avoids other orangutans
and stays close to her human handlers.

She was raised by humans and
might even think that she's human.
Boram stays in her own cage

and refuses to enter
the new orangutan habitat.

She's a typical orangutan and
it's sad to see her play all alone.

Will Boram get along with
the other orangutans someday?

The staff couldn't repeat the same
mistakes they made in the past.

The zoo tries effective methods
used in foreign zoos.
<i>Judy, female, age: 12
<i>Lifting baby

Judy is distracted
and doesn't pay attention.

<i>Woo Gyeong-mi, Primates House zookeeper</i>
Look at this. It's a baby, right?

Judy, now this is
how you hold the baby.

Oh, cute baby.
You hold the baby like this.

Judy, you can do it.
Yes, you can do it.
Now cuddle the baby.

Did Judy learn anything
from the video?

Judy doesn't show an interest
in the doll.
She lightly touches it.

But when the zookeeper
threatens the doll, she reacts.
Judy, hold the baby properly.

She starts to groom the doll
and shows her affection.
Judy, hold the doll like it's a baby.
Judy, hug the doll.

Judy holds the baby as it was shown
to her in the video.
It's going great.
She even lifts the baby with her feet.

<i>Woo Gyeong-mi, Primates House zookeeper</i>
She's able to learn new things.

She's following the actions she saw
in the video in the same sequence.

Grooming the baby, using her lips,
and then lifting the baby with her feet.

I think she'll be able
to raise her own baby.

Judy will become a good mother
at this rate.

When she enters a different room,
she takes the doll with her.

title: Baby Chimp, Chimpanzee Parenting - Primates In the City, #08, 침팬지의 육아
